ags:resource.dc:title: ASSESSMENT OF SUPERFICIAL PROPERTIES OF MATERIALS THROUGH TRANSFERRING LIQUIDS BY SURFACE-ACTIVE SUBSTANCES

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Author perform an assessment of superficial properties of materials through transferring liquids by surface-active substances based on the determination of the displaced fluid located in a layer of known thickness.Results of studies in the application of drip and non-contact methods are presented. Features of non-contact method of superficial properties: emergence of dark spots at the beginning of the movement of the liquid and formation of ring structures. Authors show the important feature of interaction of surfactants with the surface water above a layer of sand - formation of moving objects.

ags:resource.dc:title: CREATION OF THE DIGITAL MATHEMATICAL AND STATISTICAL MAP OF PSATIOAL DIFFERENTIATION OF THE LANDSCAPE IN ORDER TO INSURE NATURE PROTECTION (ON THE EXAMPLE OF THE LESSER CAUCASUS WITHIN AZERBAIJAN BORDERS)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In this research we describe the landscape differentiation by methods of PC-based digital mapping using the geoinformation system MAPINFO 5 and SURFER 8.

ags:resource.dc:title: DEVELOPMENT OF MINING NON-METALLIC BUILDING MATERIALS IN RUSSIA IN XXI CENTURY

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the presented article authors consider certain aspects of development of mining non-metallic building materials in Russia. Negative effect of surface mining are shown. In addition authors present the environmentally safe technology of sub-surface mining of non-metallic building materials.

ags:resource.dc:title: FROM THE SPATIAL ANALYSIS OF TERRITORIES TO THE BALANCED SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF PEOPLE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article, theoretical aspects of management of territorial social and economic systemsâ€™ development have been investigated on the basis of setting and maintenance balanced interrelations and proportions on all systemic levels.

ags:resource.dc:title: INNOVATION IN NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC EDUCATION IN AZERBAIJAN - CREATION OF DIGITAL DVD-TUTORIALS AND ELECTRONIC THEMATIC MAPS ON THE PC

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: New information technologies are now being actively used in the educational process and in development of digital training materials (DVD-tutorials, multimedia tutorials, geoinformational, digital and voice-maps in different areas of geography) in order to develop geographical education. Our article is devoted to the development of digital tutors and thematic maps in the field of national geography (physical and economic) of the Azerbaijan Republic.

ags:resource.dc:title: MATHEMATICAL AND STATISTICAL PC MODELING OF INTRASYSTEM AND INTERCOMPONENT INTERRELATION BETWEEN PHYSICAL AND GEOGRAPHICAL COMPLEXES IN ORDER TO ENSURE RATIONAL NATURE MANAGEMENT (ON THE EXAMPLE OF THE LESSER CAUCASUS WITHIN AZERBAIJAN BORDERS)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article we describe the methodology of mathematical-statistical modeling of internal interrelation of elements of the geosystem and intercomponents of the geosystyem in order to ensure rational nature management.

ags:resource.dc:title: NATIONAL GEOINFORMATION SYSTEM OF NATURAL RESOURCES OF THE AZERBAIJAN REPUBLIC FOR ENVIRONMETNTAL PROTECTION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: One of the main problems of natural and economic planning of the natural and anthropogenic geosystem is the detection of urgent characteristics of various types of geosystems through application of the complex of methods of modern mathematics such as, theory of information (information-statistical methods and etc.); theory of mathematic statics (methods of factoral, regressional, correlational, component and dispersional analysis etc.); theory of linear and matrix algebra (methods of linear programming, simplex methods and etc.); theory of distribution (methods of parameters estimation of universe etc.); theory of random functions (methods of definition of probability of events etc.); theory of graphs; theory of catastrophes etc.

ags:resource.dc:title: PECULIARITIES OF REGULATION OF THE FUNCTIONING PROCESSES OF ANTHROPOGENIC LANDSCAPES IN AZERBAIJAN

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In various natural landscapes of Azerbaijan creation of systematic regulation of agro-irrigational, cultivated-plantation and dry-farming-agricultural landscapes has a tremendous significance. Many questions of appropriateness of formation, functioning and regulation of anthropogenic landscapes in various regions of Azerbaijan have already been practically studied. It is especially true concerning irrigational regions of the republic, where in most areas land-reclamation situation is unfavorable (in such conditions it is impossible to perform a rational planning of various anthropogenic landscapes formation).

ags:resource.dc:title: STUDY OF THE SPATIAL DIFFERENTIATION OF NATURAL COMPLEXES BY THE METHOD OF THE PC-BASED MATHEMATICAL-CARTOGRAPHICAL MODELING IN ORDER TO ENSURE RATIONAL NATURE MANAGEMENT (ON THE EXAMPLE OF THE AZERBAIJAN TERRITORY)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article we describe the methodology of regional differentiation of natural geosystems in order to ensure rational nature management.

ags:resource.dc:title: MODERN CONDITION AND STABILITY OF BROAD-LEAVED FORESTS IN NOVGOROD REGION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author compares taxational parameters, status and stability of broad-leaved forests in the Novgorod region
